1.scene: You wake up in your modest apartment on the morning of your first major political rally. The nation is in turmoil - economic crisis, social unrest, and government corruption have left people desperate for change.

2.scene: Your speech electrifies the crowd! People chant your name, but a journalist accuses you of fearmongering. Camera flashes pop as the crowd waits for your response.

3.scene: Your socialist message resonates with workers, but a wealthy industrialist pulls you aside. 'I can fund your campaign,' he whispers, 'if you're reasonable about policies affecting my factories.'

4.scene: In a plush office, a lobbyist slides an envelope across the table. 'Pass this law, and there's more where that came from.' The sum could transform your campaign.

5.scene: Your base loves the attack! But military leaders take notice - a general invites you to discuss 'shared interests' over dinner.

6.scene: The journalist publishes a surprisingly fair piece about you, but your hardcore supporters feel betrayed. Poll numbers dip.

7.scene: The crowd goes wild, but moderate voters are alienated. Your campaign manager warns you're becoming too extreme.

8.scene: With industrial funding, your campaign grows, but socialist allies discover the deal. They threaten to expose you unless you reject the money.

9.scene: Your integrity inspires small donors, but you lack funds for TV ads. A foreign government offers 'discreet support' through shell companies.

10.scene: The law passes easily with lobbyist support. You're rising fast! But a staffer threatens to leak evidence of your deal unless paid off.

11.scene: Your expos√© makes headlines! The lobbyist is arrested, but powerful figures now target you. Death threats arrive daily.

12.scene: The generals propose a 'partnership' - they'll ensure your victory if you give them expanded powers afterward.

13.scene: The military turns against you, spreading rumors you're weak on security. But grassroots supporters organize to defend you.

14.scene: Your base accepts the apology but enthusiasm wanes. Opponents smell blood and attack your 'weakness.'

15.scene: You gain centrist support but lose passionate volunteers. The campaign feels hollow but effective.

16.scene: Your rallies become more extreme. Establishment figures call you dangerous, but your base would die for you.

17.scene: The pivot works! Poll numbers rise, but former allies accuse you of selling out. Protesters disrupt your events.

18.scene: The industrialist feels betrayed and funds your opponent. Your campaign struggles but maintains integrity.

19.scene: You purge socialists from your movement. The industrialist rewards you handsomely. Factories hum while workers suffer.

20.scene: Foreign money floods in through dark channels. Your ads dominate airwaves, but intelligence agents start following you.

21.scene: Your shoestring campaign relies on volunteers. The passion is real, but you're being outspent 100-to-1.

22.scene: The blackmailer returns demanding more. Your funds dwindle as paranoia grows. Someone is leaking your secrets.

23.scene: The staffer 'disappears.' Police ask uncomfortable questions. Your inner circle is terrified of you.

24.scene: From underground, you coordinate leaks exposing the powerful. The people rise up in your name!

25.scene: At a rally, gunfire erupts. Your security tackles you as chaos ensumes. They're trying to assassinate you!

26.scene: The military delivers your victory! But now they dictate policy. Dissenters 'vanish' in the night.

27.scene: The generals are insulted. They launch a smear campaign calling you 'anti-military.' State media parrots their line.

28.scene: Millions march singing your name! The military hesitates to fire on such crowds. International media broadcasts the standoff.

29.scene: From exile, you watch your movement collapse without leadership. The military consolidates power.

30.scene: You outflank opponents with extreme rhetoric. The base loves it, but mainstream parties unite against you.

31.scene: Steady moderation wins over the exhausted majority. You're leading in polls but hated by both extremes.

32.scene: You master the art of saying nothing while appearing sincere. Donors love your 'electability.'

33.scene: A fiery speech reignites the base! But undecided voters are scared off by your passion.

34.scene: Your brownshirts patrol rallies, attacking opponents. The government threatens to ban your movement.

35.scene: Violent supporters act on your rhetoric anyway. You're blamed for the bloodshed.

36.scene: Police brutalize protesters at your command. The opposition is cowed, but you've created martyrs.

37.scene: You meet protesters' leaders. Some are moved by your sincerity, others call it a trick.

38.scene: Volunteers canvass every neighborhood. Your message spreads organically despite media blackout.

39.scene: New backers demand even more favors than the industrialist. The cycle continues...

40.scene: You secretly fund worker cooperatives while publicly toeing the industrial line. The hypocrisy weighs on you.

41.scene: Returning the money angers foreign sponsors. They leak damaging info about you out of spite.

42.scene: Factories shut down as workers strike. The economy reels. The establishment panics!

43.scene: You win several local seats, building a base. National power seems within reach in a decade.

44.scene: Your confession shocks the nation. Some admire your honesty, others say it proves all politicians are corrupt.

45.scene: The confession implicates powerful figures. They orchestrate your 'suicide' in prison.

46.scene: The revolution succeeds without you! The new leaders invite you to help draft a constitution.

47.scene: You survive but look cowardly. Support evaporates. The assassination attempt achieves its goal.

48.scene: You stand tall as the crowd shields you. The would-be assassin is apprehended. Your legend grows!

49.scene: You secretly cultivate reformist officers. A quiet coup restores civilian control - with you at the helm.

50.scene: You expose military corruption bravely. Some officers defect to your side, others dig in.

51.scene: You give the military everything they want. They're satisfied but you've betrayed your voters.

52.scene: Your maximalist demands unite all factions against you. The movement fractures.

53.scene: Years later, your guerrilla campaign has destabilized the regime but at terrible human cost.

54.scene: Your new party wins shocking victories! The establishment tries to co-opt you.

55.scene: Your threats spark panic. The president declares martial law and arrests your leadership.

56.scene: As extremists dominate both sides, the silent majority embraces your steady leadership.

57.scene: Elites welcome you into their circles. The perks are nice, but your original goals fade.

58.scene: You win in a landslide! But now everyone expects you to solve impossible problems.

59.scene: The cabinet position gives you influence but no real power. You become part of the machine.

60.scene: Your movement becomes a purist sect - powerful but too extreme to ever govern.

61.scene: This balanced approach builds lasting power. Change comes slower but more sustainably.

62.scene: The public disbanding restores some trust, but hardliners call you weak.

63.scene: The weak denunciation satisfies nobody. You're blamed while losing extremist support.

64.scene: The easing calms tensions temporarily, but hardliners in your ranks plot against you.

65.scene: Real concessions split the opposition. Moderates join your coalition while radicals are isolated.

66.scene: You identify and neutralize key leaders. The movement collapses without direction.

67.scene: The general strike paralyzes the country! Business leaders beg for negotiations.

68.scene: Your unconventional candidates win surprise victories! The political landscape shifts.

69.scene: Returning to grassroots re-energizes the campaign with authenticity, if not resources.

70.scene: Your confession shocks allies and enemies alike. Some admire your integrity, others your naivety.

71.scene: The smear campaign backfires as people see foreign interference for what it is.

72.scene: The total shutdown forces the government to capitulate! Your terms are met.

73.scene: Incremental gains disappoint radicals but prove sustainable. Workers' lives improve measurably.

74.scene: Accelerating the timeline risks overreach but could capitalize on momentum.

75.scene: Slow building creates deep roots. Change comes gradually but lasts generations.

76.scene: Your anti-corruption crusade inspires a new generation of clean candidates.

77.scene: Your humility deepens public trust. You lead without becoming a strongman.

78.scene: The military splits along generational lines. Young officers overthrow the old guard!

79.scene: The compromise leaves military influence but establishes democratic processes.

80.scene: The peace deal ends the bloodshed but leaves the regime in power.

81.scene: Joining government gives you real power but forces uncomfortable compromises.

82.scene: Staying opposition keeps you pure but powerless. Your supporters grow frustrated.

83.scene: The democratic pivot wins back moderates. You're now a respectable opposition.

84.scene: The rebranding fools nobody. Paramilitaries continue operating underground.

85.scene: The purge saves your moderate image but creates dangerous enemies.

86.scene: The fiery rhetoric keeps hardliners loyal but alienates the mainstream.

87.scene: Holding out collapses the economy. The people suffer but you achieve total victory!

88.scene: The compromise delivers real gains while maintaining stability.

89.scene: National ambitions stretch your movement too thin. Local gains are lost.

90.scene: Consolidating local power builds an unshakable base for future national runs.

91.scene: Slow building from below creates the most sustainable movement of all.

92.scene: Moral authority inspires people beyond politics. Your influence grows indirectly.

93.scene: Rebuilding authentically takes years but creates something truly incorruptible.

94.scene: Riding the sympathy wave propels you to unexpected heights!

95.scene: Focusing on policy over personality builds lasting respect across the spectrum.

96.scene: Pushing further overextends your movement. The counter-revolution succeeds.

97.scene: Radicalizing alienates your base. The movement fractures and fails.

98.scene: The bold national campaign catches fire! Against all odds, you win!

99.scene: Sticking to the plan builds slowly but surely toward eventual victory.

100.scene: Asserting complete civilian control angers the reformist officers. They withdraw support.

ending_1.scene: Through principled leadership and strategic brilliance, you transform the nation! The people prosper under your visionary governance while democratic institutions remain strong. Your legacy will inspire generations.

ending_2.scene: You gained absolute power but lost yourself along the way. The nation is stable but unfree, prosperous but unequal. History will remember you as yet another tyrant who promised change but perpetuated the same old systems.

ending_3.scene: Your political career ends not with a bang but a whimper. Whether through miscalculation, compromise, or simple bad luck, you fade into obscurity. The causes you championed carry on without you, their fate uncertain.

ending_4.scene: Your body is found in a ditch, a bullet in the back of the skull. The official ruling is suicide, but everyone knows the truth. In the end, you were just another obstacle removed by those who really hold power.
